publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1734 Linda Fabiani: International Women's Day—That the Parliament on International Women’s Day congratulates the European Commission on bringing forward wide-ranging proposals to combat the trafficking of women into the current European Union member countries from candidate countries and beyond, and looks forward to the consideration of these proposals by the European Parliament. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1734 Linda Fabiani: International Women's Day—That the Parliament on International Women’s Day congratulates the European Commission on bringing forward wide-ranging proposals to combat the trafficking of women into the current European Union member countries from candidate countries and beyond, and looks forward to the consideration of these proposals by the European Parliament. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-1734 International Women's Day (lodged on 8 March 2001) Shona Robison*, Tommy Sheridan*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1734 International Women's Day (lodged on 8 March 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Colin Campbell*, Alex Neil*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael Matheson*
S1M-1734 International Women's Day (lodged on 8 March 2001) Irene McGugan*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-1734 International Women's Day (lodged on 8 March 2001) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1734 Linda Fabiani: International Women's Day—That the Parliament on International Women’s Day congratulates the European Commission on bringing forward wide-ranging proposals to combat the trafficking of women into the current European Union member countries from candidate countries and beyond, and looks forward to the consideration of these proposals by the European Parliament. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Tommy Sheridan, Fergus Ewing, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Colin Campbell, Alex Neil, Fiona Hyslop, Ms Sandra White, Michael Matheson, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Cathy Peattie

S1M-1734 International Women's Day (lodged on 8 March 2001) Richard Lochhead*
